Key Match Events: The Sacramento Kings defeated the Phoenix Suns 127-104.
Josh Okogie led all Suns in scoring with 25 points.
DeMar DeRozan was forced out of action early and did not return.
The Suns got off to a poor start with numerous turnovers, trailing 19-7 early.
Phoenix trailed just 65-61 at halftime despite being down by as much as 15 in the first half.
The Suns took their first lead of the night early in the third quarter after a 10-3 run.
The Kings responded and carried a 93-80 lead into the fourth quarter.
The Suns were down by 20 with five minutes left and emptied the bench.
Pre-Game Insights: The Suns were down key players Kevin Durant, Bradley Beal, and Grayson Allen due to injury.
